medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was in his usual health until approximately 2 months before admission when urinary frequency and urgency developed. This was followed by numbness of the face and jaw on the lower left side after dental work, persistent numbness of the lower lip and chin, and shooting pain into the left ear. Symptoms progressed with increasing lethargy, weakness, and anorexia after cystoscopy and resection of a bladder tumor. He exhibited increasing confusion prior to admission.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension, mitral valve prolapse, history of prostate cancer treated with brachytherapy 10 years earlier, nephrolithiasis decades earlier, and hip replacement.
medical_history.family_history: Father died of lung cancer at 59 years, mother died at 89 years from natural causes; brother has prostate cancer and alcoholism.
medical_history.social_history: Married, lives with wife, works in an office, exercises daily, does not smoke, drink alcohol, or use illicit drugs.
